Department: OHS Advisory - Service
Location: Toronto, ON (On-site)
Salary: $50,000.00 - $55,000.00 CAD per annum, commensurate on experience

About Us:

PEN Canada is a provider of external HR and OHS solutions; including, employment relations and health and safety advice, consultancy, BrightHR Software and PEN brainbox. We are providers to small and medium-sized businesses located throughout British Columbia, Alberta, Saskatchewan, Manitoba, Ontario, Nova Scotia, New Brunswick, Newfoundland and Labrador; with foreseeable plans of branching out to all provinces in Canada! PEN is a division of the PEN Group, based in Manchester, UK which operates in the UK, Ireland, Australia, New Zealand and, most recently, Canada. We employ over 2,500 people globally! PEN opened its first Canadian office in Toronto in September 2017 and has quickly become one of the fastest growing companies.

The Role of Technical Health & Safety Advisor:

The position of Technical Health and Safety Advisor is an office-based role. You will provide health and safety advice, support, recommendations, and solutions to PEN's clients as part of the company’s health and safety support service. You will also support the development of policies and additional services to our clients. You will be expected to work from Monday to Friday. Your regular working hours will be from 9:00 a.m. to 5:30 p.m., although applicants will need to be flexible as the needs of the business can change based on our client volume. There is significant potential for upward mobility for successful hires.

Day-to-Day Duties and Responsibilities - As a Technical Health and Safety Advisor, your duties will include:

Performing Annual Review of the client’s documentation and provided advice for implementation of their program.
Reading and analyzing a client’s health and safety policies and other related documentation for the purposes of providing advice, support, solutions and/or recommendations
Writing and revising health and safety policies in the context of the expansion of our services to other provinces
Developing material and tools for additional services PEN offers to clients (audits, training, etc…)
Conducting research on best practices and legislation and synthesize the information into coherent tools/products
Provide help on the OHS Advice phone line when required, providing relevant and correct health and safety advice, support, solutions and recommendations to our clients in a professional, efficient and practical manner
Completing internal reports following conversations and communications with clients regarding their health and safety issues
Achieving internal key performance indicators

Education/Experience:

A degree, diploma or certificate from an accredited health and safety education or training program
A minimum of one (1) year of relevant health and safety training and work experience

What you Bring to the Team:

A thorough knowledge of the Occupational Health and Safety legislation and related regulations in Canada
Excellent communication and writing skills
Analytical mind and synthesis skills
Very strong time management skills
An ability to work independently, as well as a team player
A high level of computer literacy

Why Work for PEN:

Day off on your birthday
Enhanced Benefits with Health and Dental Coverage
We offer a Registered Retirement Savings Plan (RRSP) Matching Program
Downtown Location (Right near Union Station)
Vacation Days increase after 2 and 5 years’ service
Ask about our PEN Days, and more!

PEN is a highly motivated enterprise that promotes an entrepreneurial culture. PEN is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace where all employees are valued. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates participating in our selection process.

what would the next step in my career if I'm finishing up my degree in OHS at Ryerson University?

The next step in your career after finishing your degree in Occupational Health and Safety (OHS) at Ryerson University would depend on your career goals and the type of position you are interested in. Some potential options may include:

1. Entry-level OHS positions such as a Health and Safety Coordinator, Assistant or Advisor. These roles typically involve implementing and monitoring safety procedures, providing training and education to employees, and conducting safety inspections and audits.
2. OHS Consultant: these roles are typically for individuals with more experience in the field. You would advise companies on how to comply with safety regulations and develop safety programs.
3. Specialized roles: You could choose to specialize in a specific area of OHS such as environmental health and safety, industrial hygiene, or ergonomics.
4. Management roles: As you gain more experience, you may be able to move into a management role such as a Health and Safety Manager, Director or Manager.
5. Starting your own OHS consulting company.

It's also a good idea to network with professionals in the field, and consider joining professional associations such as the Canadian Society of Safety Engineering (CSSE) or the Canadian Centre for Occupational Health and Safety (CCOHS) to stay up-to-date on industry developments, and connect with potential employers or clients.

2. How did my responsibilities and duties evolve over the course of my time at PEN Canada?
3. What were some of the most challenging situations I encountered and how did I handle them?
4. What were some of my major accomplishments during my time at PEN Canada?
5. How did I contribute to the overall success of the company?
6. What are some areas I would like to improve upon in my next role?
7. What are the skills I have developed in my role that will be useful in my next role?
8. What do I want to achieve in my next role and what kind of company do I want to work for?
9. How does my experience at PEN Canada fit into my overall career goals?
10. What did I appreciate about working for PEN Canada and what did I miss?
